The book is an easy read that keeps you interested.  The plot is a little out there but still a good read.
At first the book seem to be an advertisement for survival gear. It was way to wordy , describing how to or what was going on. After a while it got better and I enjoyed the story.
I all most put this book down, the author at times puts too much details on subjects and this slows the storyline.  But I was pleasantly surprised on how the plot goes.  A fun book to read.

I'm about half way through on my Kindle and I like it so far. I'm a bit of a prepper also and it makes you think...something like this can happen at anytime, anywhere. Looking forward to reading the rest of this book and the second book.
I liked the detail the author used to describe the scenes in this book. I felt like I was trying to get home. Good Book!

This book is well-written, with good character development and fast-paced.  It is a typical story of this genre, with 3 "heroes". The story brings them together, then follows them after they separate.  The language used by 2 of our 3 heroes is very course, with "f-bombs" on every page, even when the "good-guys" are in the presence of women and children.  The language used by bad guys is, of course, just as bad (since it couldn't be worse that the language of the good-guys).  In my opinion, the foul language detracts from the otherwise good story line.  Where I come from, the "good guys" may cuss a little now and then, but constant "f-bombs" - not.
Like others, I feel the spelling and grammar should have been more precisely edited, but I still enjoyed the story and I would recommend this book to other readers interested in this genre.

Not a five star for me but a strong four.  The main character is a prepper that breaks down on the road (EMP) and must make his way home.  The story works well and moves along nicely.  I have some minor issues with some of the scenarios he finds himself in but all in all a good read.
Overall a good read. Flow was good, technically superb. Spelling and minor grammatical errors were a little distracting, and Lrd knows I'm not a grammar Nazi. I recommend this book.

Ok when I first started this book I got a little nervous that this was going to be a little....... well corny but I got to say it turned out to be a real eye opener!! Half way through it I even got on Amazon and ordered some items to start working on my edc bag again!! Even though it has your "hero and the typical supporting characters; the actions of the everyday people are a very real possibility.  Overall this book was very entertaining thrilling and if you're the type of person that likes to be prepared. You could actually learn something from the story and that the lone hero story line just doesn't cut it!

I loved this author, but i have 19 books that all run in series. They are all by different authors, so as much as i enjoy all of them, i am going back to novels only. I get so tired of waiting for "THE END". Mamaw CJ, Maumelle, Ar.

Quick read, all in all, a good story. Too much gear description throughout, I found myself skipping detailed page after detailed page about the packing of the gear, the unpacking and the re-packing. Storyline was intriguing enough for me to finish reading however. I agree with previous reviews, many, many grammar and punctuation issues. If your main character is going to pack and unpack an unbelievable amount of gear that many times, learn to use commas. Overall, not enough plot for those looking for doomsday drama, but plenty of survivalist gear in that pack of his to keep the average prepper enthralled.

I thought that the story flowed well.  I really enjoy EOTWAWKI stories and this one didn't disappoint.  The author presented the breakdown of society pretty much how I imagine it will happen.....fast and violent.  Now that I'm hooked on the genera, I wish that every book wouldn't end up being part of a series.  It's too hard to remember to watch for the next installment.

The book is interesting. I heard about this book from a prepper and decided to buy it to read as I could not find it at my local library. The story, like I said is interesting. The man in this book is prepping for an EMP (Eltro Magnetic Pulse) that causes the nation to fall into a dictatorship and Marshall Law. He happens to be out of town on business when the EMP occurs and has to use his bug-out bag that he has on hand to help him in his walk back home. An EMP is where all electronics are wiped out. There are many flaws and things that I don't see as likely. The reason I give 3 star rating is due to the vulgarity and gruesome content in the book. Vulgar language and gruesome scenes are not for me. This book will be stored on the cloud.
Good book, read it in less than a week. It made me think of a few things I needed to do.
I enjoyed the story, it didn't get so farfetched that it became unbelieveable. If you're a fan of teotwawki tales, you'll like it.

This is a good book that is believable and written with challenges to the main character make you want to keep reading. I am looking forward to book 2 of the Going Home Series to see if Morgan, Thad, and Sarge are successful.
Good story. Rough editing, but for a "self-publish" it was a very easy read.  I really hope there is a follow-up!
This book sets up scenarios that can happen tragically it looks like more reality perfect for those truckers that are concerned about these days.
Despite the issues with the editing of the book, I loved the story.  A great story can overcome poor editing, but great editing cannot overcome a poor story..

Our protagonist is faced with the dilemma of the world reverting to Medieval times after an EMP/CME type scenario. Well written plot, poor editing and proofreading (a much too common thread I've noticed in self published E-books lately). One detractor is the use of acronyms which the reader may not be familiar such as camping equipment, knives, and firearms. However, there is an index in the back that I found once I finished the book. Looking forward to the sequel. This book does feature an abundance of action, and keeps you riveted!!!
Well written and better than typical for the genre.  There are enough twists and sidebars to keep the story going strong with very little downtime.  There was also a noted lack of preaching.

The book was not only good reading but informative too. The characters were well described and you got to know each one and what they brought to the table. I loved the action and the movement of the characters in each scene, you can actually picture each dilemma these characters were in. The sad truth is that DHS is purchasing millions of rounds of hollow points for a reason and since those rounds cannot be used overseas it tells of the possible scenario painted in this book. I cannot wait to read the next book!!
Ok book a lot of realism, but the laugage was a turn off.  I understand the possibility of the situation and hope it isn't a reality.
This book was well written and the authors character development was good. I would recommend this book to anyone who reads this type of books

Good tech information some grammar errors,but an excellent read, I couldn't put it down. It is a true measure as to how people may act. The quote that Morgan refers to is what everyone should live by," all it takes for evil to thrive is for good men to do nothing"- Edmund Burke
Too many loose ends for my taste.  Setting up for a sequel, maybe?  Poor grammar and syntax.  Interesting story for all that which is why I gave it 3 stars.

The writing style reminded me of Joe Nobody, along with the same type of story line.  The use of four different perspectives keeps a reader interested in the story.  I foresee another book with the ending this had.

Interesting book. Having done some pretty extensive backpacking, I have to say this guy's back was HUGE and heavy. That aside, I enjoyed reading the book and quickly became engrossed in the trials and challenges. Was definitely hard to put down once I started.

I really liked this book and I can't wait for the next one! You could really put yourself into the shoes of Morgan and could feel what he and the others where going through.  The only reason this is not a 5 star rating is simply due to grammatical/writing flaws that I'm sure would be taken care of had this been through a major publisher.  That said, this book should do a great job of launching the next with more support! FANTASTIC BOOK!

I truly enjoyed reading this book, and found myself unable to put it down at points in time.  I was slightly disappointed with the ending.  While I understand that it leaves the possibility of a second book.  I am not a huge fan of so many lose ends.

Great book. This is the third book I have read that shows how people might react in a situation like this. The way the book ends does make you think "what if" and "what would you do". Another book is by Bruce "Buckshot" Hemming. Grid Down Reality Bites.

I must say that I was really looking forward to reading this book and I was not disappointed. It was plausible and the author really did a good job of portraying what the landscape may look like in a SHTF scenario. I was left with the impression that a sequel would be forthcoming. The misspelled words, mediocre editing and somewhat amateurish dialogue let it down somewhat but overall, enjoyed it and learned a lot!

I have read about twenty books of this genre, and I would place it in the top 5 that I have read. The main character is realistic everyday guy which helps the story out greatly. During his journey home he runs into many different people, some good and some not so much. Those characters seem real as well. If you enjoy this type of genre, then I would recommend that you pick this one up.
This was actually a pretty good read. I would have liked it to be longer, like most in this genre, they are too short.

Overall a very good read. A little overbroad on the survivalist jargon in the beginning but typical for this genre. Good develop of main characters  and their internal struggles with changing moral landscape.  One of the better reads in this genre.

I really liked this book as it gives you a lot of things to consider about how people would act or try to deceive you in a crisis! I would definitely recommend this book to both preppers and non-preppers alike. The only thing I did not like was that it was not thoroughly proofread before publishing. Otherwise it was a great story and well worth reading!
good story line, will look for the next one in the series. easy to follow and easy to understand. I approved this message.

I'm reading a lot in this genre lately. Apocalypse/End of World books have always been a favorite of mine. And of the books I've read, this is probably the best of the bunch. It was hard to put down, so I stayed up way too late to finish it. It really grips you! I rate it four stars due to the large number of errors. Words left out, poor grammar etc. I can never figure out why someone would go to the trouble to write a book and never proofread it. It seems typical of the genre these days unfortunately and it grates. Why do they do this? Anyway, the Kindle version is just $3.79 and a great bargain. Get it!

Liked the characters but, as with alot of these types of books, the lead character always seems to have just the right type and amount of needed equipment at just the right time. And always meets up with just the right people that can keep the story going. Also talking in " dialect " for the different characters during the book is annoying. Overall a good read.  Hope there is a sequel.
Pretty good story, could benefit from better editing.  I would definitely buy the sequel if it's out there.  If they edited better, I would have given a better rating.
Likable characters, fairly faced paced.  Main character is the guy next door who just wants to go home.  Was well preped
Good book and had a different spin on a SHTF scenerio. The language was crude in places and whom ever was the grammar editor missed a bunch of stuff but well worth reading overall.

This book was a fun read.  It may not appeal to everyone with some of it's technical information about gear and such but for those who are starting to think about being prepared for various emergencies this is a good book.  The main characters were interesting and fairly easy to relate to and the story lines were entertaining.  I couldn't stop reading it.  The editing could use a little work and the switching from 1st to 3rd person perspective was a little distracting at times but overall I would purchase this again.

Overall pretty good read.  A little too much detail on things such as two pages on how dinner was made by the sarge.  Very specific on the survival gear, I had to look some things up to know what the Author was talking about, easier to call a backpack a backpack made for survivalists and a knife a knife. Etc..
The more I read of this book the better it got.  A quick glance at what could happen during a major event.

As I live in the rural area of Florida where the book was placed it had a special significance for me. The author's level of detail of this area as well as his plausible scenario made for a good read.

I thought this was a nice take on a EMP event and all that results from it.  I was enjoying it right up until the end.  The ending left me feeling like the author just got tired of writing and decided to end it though.  He set up a second group of survivers with Sarge and his group, started the story line and then just left it out there unfinished at the end.  Kind of a strange thing to do with a group that he had brought to the forefront of the story, devoting chapters to them.

I give this book a good rating in spite of spelling errors which make things confusing at times. I think it portrays a fairly realistic view of how some people will react under stressful situations. Some will be generous and kind, others will take anything they can. I enjoyed and grew to like the main characters as the story progressed. This book is not as unrealistic as some would have you believe.

After the first 8% or so, I wasn't sure if I would keep going. So glad that I did. It is a little rushed in the beginning, but it doesn't take too long to start moving along at a good pace. I hope there will be many more in the series. Great job.
Book was ok but left you hanging at the end, hope he writes next book soon to find out what happens to Thad, Sarge and the rest.

Book kept me reading to find out what happened next. Also made me aware of a few new products that I was unaware of. Very good read of a man on a mission to get home to his family after the S*** hits the fan.
Good read would recommend to others.  Best when borrowed or free.  Weaponry and gear is accurate and good for reference
I hope you are not prophetic, because as real world scary as this book is, I can see it happening
Characters were believable at first until the shooting started. They were bullet proof time and again. Too much Jesse Ventura conspiracy theory. For the price though, why not.
I found it hard to believe that he conveniently carried everything with him before the occurrence.  No one cares that stuff with them everywhere.

Going Home presents the reader with an "everyday" hero.  We don't learn much about his background, but we are lead to believe he could be you, your brother, your neighbor, etc.  I liked this story and looked for the next in the series.  I liked the supporting characters and found the tense change from 1st to 3rd person to be similar to if I was telling a story to someone that included sections from my perspective and then from another person's perspective.  There is an interesting list of the equipment used, needed, wanted that if you are into being prepared will make building your GoBag easier.  I look forward to more stories in this series.
I really enjoyed this.  The characters were well developed.  I look forward to more of this story.  It held my interest.
Good story a little detailed at times. Overall i liked it and its very relevant to todays life in america. When will we see the sequel?
Realistic story with a little to much detail but great characters and a plot line that leaves you wanting to read the next book.

It is very possible that this can be a true story one day.  I know the Bible says that a "prudent man sees the evil coming and hides himself, but the simple pass on and are punished".So get ready, be prepared !  The scriptures also say one day Christ will take His believers out of the earth and then all hell will breakout here. So be ready!
Interesting, distances ... 3 or 4 hours of driving become days of walking.  The gauntlet that society turns into.  Leaves you a little hanging.
Good plot, both timely and relevant. Very believable with an author that know about the gear used in the book.

This is not just another end of the wold story.  It brings different characters together and focuses on how they interact with each other while dealing with the end of the current world.  I have to admit that after reading this book, I put together a survival pack of my own.  You just never know.
A little bit too heavy on product names but a great concept and good story line.  I had a road trip a week after reading this.  The book actually scared me enough that I packed a get home bag.

Excellant story , very good writing . my only problem was with all the strong language . I know in real life that sort of language is used quite commonly , however I try to avoid it . i was surprised when i read so much cursing in this book. But overall if that doesn't bother you this is a great read . I took off 1 star just because of the language . The way it ended leaves it open for a sequel .
How about a spellchecker? Neat novel, interesting what a prepared novice might do. The regional details made this an interesting read.

Please write more of this story.  Now that I have this out of the way, I must say that this is the first book of survivalist... err prepper fiction that I have read.  Typos aside, I found a well paced, entertaining read.  It is an entertaining story of the everyday guy forced into what he only ever thought he would be prepared for.  Read it, most likely you will be entertained, and may even learn something.  Beware of the tinfoil parts though... or are they tinfoil?
Read a bait of books in this genre. This writer seems to know his equipment and tactics. I appreciate the advice on getting back home in a catastrophe. Lets hear some more!
And interesting read, and but I didn't know I was going to read an anti-federal government book. Prepare, or the government is going to take away your freedom!
Nice set up for more, am waiting for the story to continue, a lot of directions this could go.  Thanks
Enjoyed the story, but a good edit would bump this up another star. The sudden tense changes were disconcerting. Can still recommend this, though.
good story but a lot of typo's, enough to distract me a little bit...towards the end it was a little worse.

I found this to be an eye opener to a completely possible scenario, that would disrupt and change the lives of every American in an instant. Compelling and informative! Better editing would have warranted five stars, however that didn't diminish the story enough to discredit it. Will look forward to a continuation of the story, as the book left of in a way that begs for a sequel.

I enjoyed every minute of this book. The characters were all well developed and the story plot maintained its momentum. Not just another SHTF book. I gives a glimmer of hope that we can still make a difference and that good people can still be found.

It had good plot.  The main character was believable.  The book did keep me interested and it was hard to put down.  The only thing I found wrong was at times it jumped around.  Overall it was a pretty good book.
Good characters and good survivalist book.also was full of some great ideas and products for being prepared.story was also very good and made for a quick read

It took me a while to get into this story, Despite being a bit of a prepper myself and understanding the terminolgy, the acrynoms etc, the book bogged down at times in its descriptions and read more like a sellers hype for certain preferred products. That said the story did get better as the book went along. I would recommend some editing on the next one though cause the story suffers a bit from being jerky, spelling etc. If you want entertainment, it will do it, if you want a bestseller on ny times its not. Will appeal greatly to fellow fans of the genre

This is one of the best books I have read. I have read Patriots, Lights Out,and One Second After. This book is better than any of them. AA is an awesome writer! Once you start reading this book you won't be able to put it down. Looking forward to many more books by this author!

This book was FANTASTIC! The tactical and survival information was spot on, and the action kept me on the edge of my seat. The book covers the reality of violence and defending your self and your family, as well as natural human reactions to such things. I think it could have done without the cursing, but I can live with it. Outstanding job.

I liked the story line, however some the explanations and details of what a character was doing in detail seemed to drag on. In other areas where I would have liked that detail, it was not shared. Overall, I enjoyed the read and now I am on the second book.  I have spent up to 3 hours reading at a time on some days in this series.

I really liked this story despite the author getting a bit too detailed in the description of even mundane actions. I am glad I stuck with it because the second book in the series got even better and the subsequent additions to the series remained at that high level. I am eagerly waiting for book five to come out later this month.

Good read.  Actually found myself on the edge of my seat at times. Loved the humor, helps to have been in the military.  I could actually relate to the feeling of how everyone was able to joke with each other and how quickly they accepted one another, again it helps to have been in the military.  Looking forward to the next book.

Overall a good read if you like the genre, but poor grammar/editing and predictable story line holds it back. The author tries to throw every possible survival scenario into this book and it got old. The main character is likable and there were times when I could not put the book down.  But in the end the execution was a bit off.

I judge these types of books solely on the number of scenarios they get to think about, the likelihood of those scenarios, and the severity of the scenarios.  I don't pick at grammar errors, stylistic tics, character development, or dialogue. For me this isn't pleasure reading, its survival planning. This series is a winner.

Going home is a great description of what could happen in a national emergency situation.  The overall story is very gripping.  I didn't give this book 5 stars because the author goes a little too deep in his naming of each item, with model and brand information.  Also, the book seems to be a prepper's manifesto of sorts.

Great story. I was hooked right from the start, and the ending left me eager to start the second book. I really enjoyed the detail that was put into the equipment used. The editing was rough, but not enough to make me stop reading. And it seemed to improve as the book progressed. Looking forward to the rest of the series.

Hope it never comes to something like this but I'm one of the few that can say I think I'm ready. I was able to use some of this info to order some more supplies for my get home bag. Wife wasn't too happy but if I ever need to use it I will remind her of when she didn't want me to buy more stuff. :)

Spinechilling!!!!  It makes me want to go out and stock up on all the stuff the characters did and more.  It is such a real possibility it scares the living daylights out of me!  The world is in such a terrible state and our government is so shakey at the present time I believe it could happen!

A very real look at how many of the "entitled" class would act if we had a major disaster in this country. Also, with this administration running martial law exercises and knowing that the military fights the way it trains I could see them trying a false flag and declaring martial law.

The story is good, but the narrative is too wordy. We don't really need to know everything he did every hour of the day. That being said, I am going to continue with the second book and see where it goes. New authors learn as they go, and maybe he will cut out the excess description. We'll see

An excellent portrayal of a world changing event.  It was an engaging story with realistic characters and scenarios that I thoroughly enjoyed.  I would recommend it to all readers of survival fiction.  Great for gear hounds too!

A little out there but not nearly as far fetched as you might think. Everyone should have a contingency plan, be it extra food, water or fuel, and it is everyone's Christian duty to have the ability and fortitude to defend and provide for themselves and their loved ones in a time of crisis.

I've read all five in the series and can not wait for the next one. Never dull and very well written. Fast paced and exciting. The best part is that, this story rings true. Most books have imagery and fantasy these days. This series does not. I'd recommend this to anyone who is interested.

When I first started the book, it held my attention, but as the characters grew and the story line reach out, it turned in to a passion for the next chapter. AA does such a great job you feel like your part of the story.

This was so well written I thought I was watching a movie. Just couldn't put it down. Hated to see it end but from the ending I'm sure there will be a sequel. Also it was enlightening on how a grid down scenario would likely evolve. I highly recommend this book you won't regret it.

Rated 4 stars because I enjoyed the book. Did not give it a 5, because I do not personally like the very detailed descriptions about preparing meals and other daily tasks. I would recommend this book to anyone that likes to read about surviving a major change in American lifestyle.

After reading the first initial chapters I was about ready to put the book down.  It really annoyed me that the character had EVERYTHING in his backpack.  However, I kept reading and it got better.  It kept me entertained and finished it.  I liked it enough to purchase the sequel.

Love the story and the characters. I started preparing myself and my family in case of a disaster because of this book. Sometimes it takes you diving into another world to realize how fragile yours is. I recommend this to anyone, I am looking forward to the rest of the series !

I am a voracious reader of this genre and was seriously excited to try this book.  I settled in with my little kindle and prepared to be whisked away on a journey of the great American survival story.  Well after about 10 pages, I decided that instead, my mission to find the worst book every written was complete.  Not what I was after but, at least I got something accomplished.

Listened to the audiobook version of this. Even at 2X playback, this thing is dull. Characters are completely flat and react very unrealistically to their circumstances. If you want to play a drinking game, just listen for the acronym MRE. It's a definite eye roller.

Just a very good way to get people to think of the events and how many days till anarchy hits. I am now on my third book, please read the first book with a legal pad and a pen .  Write Dow every bit of equipment  you come across it will make life much easier.  Enjoy

The plot was a typical apocalyptic tale; however, the humor made for an entertaining book.  A. American does an excellent job of teaching survival skills while weaving every day life into the story.  Obviously he is a storyteller with a sense of humor.

Usually enjoy this genre, but this read like an ad for a name brand survival gear catalog with a thin story line wrapped around it. Made me wonder if the author or anyone connected to the book got a kickback for every time he mentioned their gear....

This book is a great read and I learned so many things about survival.  I am now reading the 4th book in the series, this is the best in the series but I am captured into wanting to follow this group of people and see how they manage in the disaster.
I am warning you this story will casue you to loose sleep. This book is very addicting.  Once you start it's hard to put down.  A great catastrophic near end of the world story.  Must read.

I enjoyed the book.  I thought you were a little harsh regarding the old ladies in the neighborhood. It is just the way neighborhoods operate and always have.  It was a good book with an interesting theory and I am looking forward to the next one.

If you like this genre of story this is a very good one. Believable characters, believable story lines and plenty of action. I would rate it up there with the book "One Second After" if you are familiar with that, well written.

I enjoined the story, what I didn't enjoy was the details about all the items he had with him. At times, the amount of brand names of the "quality expensive items" was too much for me so I had to skip a page or two.

A good read, lots of action...yes, not very realistic or likely to occur in some cases...but hey, it's supposed to be entertainment too, not a military manual. It does have some thought provoking ideas and choices on gear

This is one of the most poorly developed and written books that I have ever read.  I'm interested in the post-apocalyptic genre so it takes a lot to make me lose interest in a book of this type.  This book seems as though it was not edited.  The book must have started out extremely rough if it was edited.  The writer has middle school, or even elementary school, sensibilities and the writing is basically a series of him indulging himself in gear and societal fantasies without any thought to developing a compelling plot.  This book really deserves no stars and I am astounded that there are so many 5-3 star ratings in relation to 1-2 star ratings.  This must be the result of ratings from the large community of people who secretly love the idea of the end of the world because it allows them to try out all of the neat gear that they purchased.  Even they will tire of the tedious lists of equipment that are actually the main character of the book.

If sh*t hits the fan, this is exactly what's going to happen. I read this book in 4 days it was that good. And I am a 30 year old female who has never thought about how things in this country could change in an instant.

The character and situation are well written. The "products" are not described very well. For instance he put on a Carhartt. So was it pants or a jacket.  No reason why he chose that product over similar ones.

Too much listing gear by name.  Has a real slap ass good ole boys view of the military that was annoying.  Overall a good read just obvious that he wrote this after spending a few too many days on a dooms day forum.

The test of a good book in a series is, do you order the next. Or does it go on your someday/maybe list. The moment I turned the last page, I ordered the second. Believable well developed characters. Great read.

I got about 15 pages in before realizing the writing style was not going to improve.  I am sure there is good information in the book but it is certainly not going to win any awards for creative use of words.

Language is a little rough starting out but it mellows out and becomes more realistic not recommended for minors due to language but a really good read - I enjoyed it and now reading the next book in series.

Love the story from this perspective of the civilian world Morgan is a great character and I look forward to see how his story progresses. I also just love sarge , Mike and the boys. Overall a great series.
When I began reading this book the first few pages drug me down & I was thinking "is THIS what this book is going to be like?", but then it quickly picked up & got better & better the further I got.
I like the idea of a EDT pack. But just how heavy was this guy's pack? I started wondering when he mentioned pulling out a "cutting board" for food preparation.  Good book,  not very realistic.

I love this book. A American should be us all. this could be I'd.if it should happen we better be ready. people will turn and they will kill. the government will not help. be ready and protect your own
I enjoyed this book. Good characters, good story, interesting information about bugging out and being prepared. Excellent story of a man wanting to get to his family. Looking forward to the sequel.
Well written, great characters. Little heavy on the F word for me, otherwise, excellent. In today's world, the premise of this book is very believable. Will definitely read the rest of the series.
It is not very well written at all. A little better than some others, but still a "B" grade book.
The first book is a little rough in a couple of places, but the character development, plot lines, dialog, etc. are great. Funny reference to Wesley Rawles 'Patriots'. Everyone's a critic, huh?
Great read! I could not put it down! Its a very entertaining book that kept me on the edge of my seat in anticipation. Highly recommend this book to anyone that Is into this genre of fiction.
I've read quite a few books from this genre and this is among the best!  I highly recommend it.  I'm on the second book in the series right now, Surviving Home, and it's just as good, so far.
I loved the story line!  There was a lot of military jargon in the book and perhapse not the best written book but I truly enjoyed the story line.  I will be buying the rest of the series.
Enjoyed it, really sparked the imagination and what can happen if something should go wrong. The book was written well for a first time author. I enjoyed it enough to buy the next book.
The story is good but the book needs editing.  I will read the second book in the series simply because I am enjoying the story, but I hope that the character development gets better.
Great story that kept my interest! I highly recommend this book for anyone interested in action. I have already read half of the second book only 2 days after finishing this one.....
A great story.  There were some mistakes in the Kindle edition, but the story completely overpowered the occasional missing word.  It was so good I ordered a print copy for a friend.
Great Book. I couldn't put it down. Well written and entertaining with a lot of thought knowledge that could be useful. So good in fact that I bought the other 3 books in the series.
This was a great book and series. I could not put the books down. I highly recommend all  four books in this series. I would love to read more about what happens after the last book.
I worry that novels like this are all to close to a possible reality in the near future, including the participation of tyrannical government personnel, both elected and unelected.
Book was ok but the notion of the main charater hvaingnevery thing he needs in the trunk of his car is a little too easy.  Plus the whole fema army thing is kind of hard to believe
Great book. It is like you are the one the book is about. Made me realize there are a lot of simple things that I have overlooked in preparing to get home or go rescue someone.
The story is very good, and I learned quite a few things about being prepared if you need to travel home on foot.  The writing itself I would give a C, the story concept an A.
This book had me reevaluating security, food and travel.  The description of the breakdown of society is all the more believable after watching the riots in the Midwest.
I love survivalist books and though I was unsure if I liked the writing style at first, I quickly got into the story. Great read and great tips for your own reparations.
Fun book and gives you a lot to think about, should one ever have to walk home. The author isn't a great writer but he tells a good story. Gear whores are gonna love it.
Very believable when EMP breaks civilization down into good and evil.  The government conspiracy make for a good read, but more likely just overwhelmed and ineffective.
Not the best written book ever, but solid concepts and story make this a read for anyone with a survival/Prepper mindset or anyone who like post apocalyptic fiction
Nice thesis makes for a good plot.  Sometimes a bit bumpy along the way.  Too much detail about equipment and survival items detracts from the flow of the story.
Very fast read but a very good read. Extremely thought provoking and scary to contemplate as even NASA says a Mass Coronal Ejection is a very real possibility.
It kept my interest the entire book and the way the government reacted falls in line with today's administration. Also some good prepping insight and ideas.
Poorly edited, but a good story nonetheless. Waiting for the follow up. Smaller paperback size would have been better, hard to fit this one into my pocket.
Great read but I don't like being FORCED to write a small description just to leave a rating. Needs to be changed as this is my last rating until it does
Although fiction lots of good info included. Bought and read all the books in this series. Hope there will be another in the series coming out shortly.
Struggle, survival, hunger, thugs, refugees, friends, questions and trying to get from point A to point B everything you need in a desperate world.
I absolutely loved it. I'm 22 haven't read a book since high school and never enjoyed it but reading this book made me want to read all the time.

This series is great. Anyone rating this a 1 star because they think the main characters pack weight is "unrealistic" is just ridiculous. There are a lot of complaints that the author goes into too much detail about the gear he carries. That view must be coming from the T.V crowd that rather have an image shown than rely on their imagination.
Good read! can't wait for book 2 , added some additional items to my bug out bag from this story LOL!
This is a nicely written series.  The hero is placed in a realistic situation and makes enough mistakes to be relate-able to the reader.  Enjoy.
Just finished reading 'Going Home' and I loved it. Once I started reading it, I couldn't put it down.  Can't wait will the next book comes out.
Good read and a quick read, gives you enough to keep you interested.  Things that happen make you think how you would handle such a scenario.
Perfect book for someone that is like minded. Once I got started I could not put it down. I will definitely be recommending it to my friends.

I read this book as posted on a message board and every chapter left you yearning for more. AA has a way of getting you to feel as if your personally know these characters and care about every move they make! I have been reading full length novels since I was 10 years old and to me, AA is right up there with the top writers. Even surpassing many of my favorites and this is definitely the best book in the EOTW genre that I have read, topping even "One Second After", which was my previous favorite. This book also opened my eyes to how ridiculously unprepared my family and I are, should there ever be any event similar to the events depicted in this book! I will buy every book in this series and will ALWAYS read any books published by this talented author!
excellent story line with this book, the kindle edition had some serious spelling issues. Editing for kindle editions needs to be improved!
This novel will keep you interested from page to page. So many prepping tips and instructions. Great storyline. Ready to start next book!
Excellent beginning to the series, we all could find ourselves in the situations Morgan finds himself in even though he is prepared.
Definitely a recommended read. I'm Excited to read the next one. Hoping this actually never happens in the US or any other country.
Great book!  It really lays out the personal impact on your mind and how far you could go to get justice or fight for your beliefs.
THIS SERIES IS A MUST READ FOR ALL OF US WHO ARE PREPARING FOR THE WORST.  THEY ARE THE MOST INFORMATIVE SURVIVAL BOOKS OUT THERE.
Can't wait to read the others. I have read several lime this and his is a good one. Gave it to a friend and got them hooked also.
Fast and easy read; I couldn't put it down. The characters are easy to like and their storylines engaging. I highly recommend it!
Nice easy to read post apocalyptic novel. Looking forward to the next novels the series.  Enjoy the gear details but some won't.
A great read. I learned many survival skills from his description of getting home. I look forward to reading more of his books.
Very easy read. I would recommend to anyone.  The story seemed to flow very well.  Seemed to follow along the story line well
A little gear focused felt like an advertisement at times but I understand that some "preppers" really push brands.
I'm on the second book and really enjoy reading this series. I think it would make a great mini series or couple of movies.
This is a great series and a very enjoyable read, especially living in central Florida.  I recognize many of the locations.
I think it's a very good story. Seems like it could happen. Not completely out there like some other stories I have read.
Excellent story....am disappointed that the three sequels aren't on audio CD like the first one or I would buy all three.
This is a good plot and easy reading. The authors use of foul language really distracted from this being a great book.

I really enjoyed this book! I had a super hard time putting it down and ended up sitting up half the night to finish:)  This author does a really nice job of creating the atmosphere and mood without too many words. Took the emotion of the situations presented and made it relatable.  I liked there were characters with opposing viewpoints.  It takes a talented author to present both sides well, even if there is going to only be one outcome.  I found a few typos/spacing issues towards the end that hadn't been present in the begining but not enough to throw you off.  Well written, well researched, and well enjoyed by this reader.
Excellent reading! I purchased all 4 of the remaining books in the series immediately after finishing the first one.
A good yarn, an easy read, characters simply drawn, told with a message of survival, endurance and preparedness.
I found it enjoyable and think you will too if you like this type of story.  I found it quick and easy to read.

Going Home is different, and in a very good way.  So much post-apocalyptic fiction is about as well written as this review, and as believable as Alice in Wonderland interspersed with long paragraphs often erroneous technical drivel.  Going Home breaks that trend with well developed characters who we really care about doing realistic things in a situation that's within the realm of possibility.  It's a good read for anyone who enjoys action/adventure or military fiction and is threaded with a warning about the future of our freedom without being preachy.  Can't wait for the sequel!
An enjoyable book to read and very informative for disaster preparedness. I will read another in the series.
I am enjoying this series and looking forward to the next one. Quite a few typos but that didn't bother me.
This is without a doubt one of the best series of books in this genre. Definitely makes you stop and think.
Liked the book, a bit far fetched, but definitely kept you on your toes. I have to read the entire series!
A terrific story about a journey home, and a strange time to do it.  I can't wait to start the next book!
This book was great, if you like details and worst case scenario stories then you will love this book.
A very real view as to what you can expect from society and what life would be like due to a crisis!
Great book! If you like this one, i reccomend the next three in the series. Keep it up A. American!

I COULD NOT PUT THIS BOOK DOWN ONCE I STARTED READING IT. I SELDOM READ STORYLINES INVOLVING CATASTROPHIC EVENTS, POLITICAL MISHANDLING OF GOVERNMENT OR PREPPING AND BUGGING OUT.THIS BOOK HAD EVERYTHING FAMILY, WINDOWLICKERS GOOD PEOPLE DOING WHAT'S NEEDED, GOOD AND BAD DEEDS.THE BEST PARTS WERE ALL THE PEOPLE WHO WEREN'T PREPARED AND EXPECTED EVERYTHING TO BE HANDED TO THEM. I SEE THAT EVERYDAY AT WORK AND IN MY OWN COMMUNITY. THE DETAILS PUT INTO THE ESCAPE AND EVASION PARTS IN THE BOOK WERE SPOT ON. WRITE MORE. PLEASE.
Its a good read. I like how the author names his equipment so I can go research for my own supply.
This book was amazing and put in mind so much more than I ever thought of about mind preparedness.

This book hit home more seeing as I am from central Florida and could totally imagine what a sheet storm it would be like getting home after an EMP. I would imagine there would be swarms of tourist on the roads fleeing the state so renowned for bugs, hurricanes, con artists, heat, and trigger happy folks. I was just waiting for a gator attack in your book.  Can't wait till the next in the series.

This is a gripping story of a man's journey to get home to his family following an EMP event.  The character development is just enough without dwelling on a persons entire life.  The focus on surviving encounters with "lost" souls, both catatonic and hostile, is thought provoking, and resolute. Anyone who is looking to detach from the "zombie" genre, with a passion for survivalist novels will find this series a perfect fit.
Great series.  Very "republican" in opinions, but overall, a very good book and series.
deleted

amazing book and scary true with the world we live in can't wait to read the next one 5 stars
Loved this book and all the books in this series. A must read if you are preparedness minded.
Real page turner. These 3 books are well written and are on the higher side of the genera.
I have read many survival authors.  This isn't my favorite series, but I still enjoyed it.

Not necessarily my genre, I'm more of a Zombie and Horror fan, so I was a bit leary.  After reading the first few pages, I was afraid all the 5 star reviews were fake.  I soldiered on, and am glad I did.  This is an incredible book.  Not only a page-turner, but a scary and truthful look into our current Administration, and their disgusting desires. this was a great book, fast paced and an enjoyable read.  if you like 'trying to get home after tshtf' kinda books, you will enjoy this.  it was one of those cant put down books because you needed to see what was around the corner.  i thought the characters were developed real well, it was good to see some ordinary folks facing some incredible challenges and thinking things out.  and it left you dying for the sequel--wheres the sequel---you got a sequel, right?  right?
Had no idea I'd get hooked. Easy to read and, perhaps, a little forewarningly relevant.
A little dry at times. A little too much jargon. Character development could be better.
This is a book series that everyone should read if you are worried about Bugging Out!
The  language was  unfit  for  my husband's or my eyes and  intelligence  Book could have been written  with  a greater grasp of the  English  language.  we threw the books in the trash
Very engaging read, keeps you locked in but has a lot of un-necessary bad language.

This story is written from the perspective of a prepper so if thats your interest you will definitely find this book very interesting. I can't get any work done around the house because, I can't put the book down :-)

As a resident of North Florida, I was shocked when I read the preview and discovered the story takes place in areas very familiar to me. My husband really enjoyed this book. It was a quick read for him but enjoyed it!

Not your typical post apocalyptic writing. There is the how to element that gives the reader a good starting point on making a long foot patrol in a dangerous environment. The best part is the no holds barred immersion of the characters into difficult, realistic situations that would test anyones fortitude and faith in this setting. I learned things by reading this, so it was both enjoyable and money well spent.
Great series! Lots of practical info wrapped around a rollicking thrill ride!

I just happened upon this book looking for something to read while I wait for the next book in another series to come out. This book was great!  The author hits the the proverbial nail with the descriptions of the area and dialect. It is surreal to read as i live in the middle of the area he describes and have been through all the small towns in the book. Can't wait for the next one to come out.
Great book....an awesome read....great useful info hidden in the story also.
Reads like a rough draft written by someone who borders on the illiterate. Totally unbelievable characters and storyline ... just awful.

The premise and the situations in this book seem so real, and are really well potrayed. I even followed the character along his journey by looking at Google earth maps of the loations he mentions. Really helped expand the experience. The other books start drifting and once again like so many SHTF books the characters progress to become super leaders. But this book is right on.

Great book. Doubtful that many people would be as prepared as the main character is. Very interesting reading, fast moving action, good character's, could not wait to start the next book. Some of the terminology I did not understand, a glossary of terms, such as is provided in "Patriots" would have been helpful, but it did not distract from the story.
Couldn't put it down, having the same problem with the second one now
Good book.  Could hardly put it down.  Hope the next one is as good.

Have read numerous other survival books by authors who don't seem to care enough to hire a decent editor. But A. American is either a Good writer or has a very polished editor, because there are almost no grammatical or syntactical errors in the book. His characters are well developed, and he does not complicate the story line. The only drawback is I didn't get my truck fixed the day I started the book because I couldn't put the book down until I had finished.
I loved the story.  The language was a little on the rough side and I would be glad to proofread any future works for free.
I liked this.  Plenty of room for a good sequel.  Realistic and kept your attention.  Also enough detail without going overboard

I just hate when people that dont write feel the need to slam an authors work.  Sure there were some things that could have been edited better, but then maybe a view "critics" should be "edited" too.  I am getting close to reading every "prepper" book on Amazon and found this to simply be a fast paced read.  This is fiction and not Of Mice and Men CRITICS!
Well written, hard to put down, just begs you to read another page!

I enjoyed this book so much, i had problems putting it down.  Very well written and also a 'believable' story line to what life could be like after a disaster.  It really makes you think about what could happen in the future and what you could do to prepare.  I don't leave a lot of reviews (and I should) but i felt this one deserved the time.
Excellent!  Well written and entertaining, as well as informative.
Well written. I enjoyed it. I just bought the next in the series.
Cannot wait for Dec. . . ready for the next book in the series!!!
A very riveting read and one that is very close to being reality.

If you need a plan to follow for what to do when if the USA gets hit with an EMP then this book is for you. This is about an average guy trying to make it home. There is a lot of info on weapons and equipment to carry and use. Just hoping that society doesn't break down as quick as this story predicts. A very good read.

Morgan is on Interstate 10 just outside of Tallahassee, Florida, when the SHTF.  He has to get home to central Florida.  Living near Tallahassee and knowing Highway 27 south, I can vouch that all of these little roads and towns he went through look exactly like they were described.  The author provides so much detail in description that you can almost smell the earth, the river, the rain, and the pine forests.  He even got the temperature right for November weather.  Morgan is a prepper with a Bug-Out-Bag fit to kill.  He has stuff you'll want to add to yours.  The things he does and the methods in which he does them could really help some of those idiots on the Doomsday Preppers show.  He doesn't start walking home immediately--he spends the night in the car and goes through his bag, deciding what to keep and what he doesn't need--his analysis is interesting.  His walk and listen technique added so much time to his trip, but he stayed with the drill.  He doesn't take more than about 60 seconds with a person before he can size him up and decide if he's a friendly or not.  If not, he takes the offense right away and backs people down or leaves them in a puddle.  The girl who won't leave him alone and tags along is just the type of person you DON'T want walking with you and she nearly gets him killed several times.  I wanted to slap her silly.  I hope every man who reads the book resolves to say NO louder and longer than Morgan did, or you probably wouldn't make it home.  It was nice to have a glossary at the end--I've read a lot of books in this genre, and still there were some acronyms I didn't know.
Excellent series. Once you pick it up , you can't put it down.

I was completely blown away by this book! The characters are very believable and the Plot is excellent.  Once I started reading it, I didn't want to put it down. This would also make a great Movie.  I really hope he continues with more books along this story line.  This is a must read if you like this type of book!

I really liked the story line and the way the author weaved other charcters in. Being set in Florida especially the Ocala National Forest area just added an extra layer to the book knowing the area and his descriptions tell that he has done his homework. I consumed the book in one day, just could not put it down!
Took a chance and was pleasantly surprised!!  Very good read!
Excellent read, though some serious proof reading is needed.
Excellent and informative. Cant wait to read the next one.

Just finished this book, couldn't stop reading once I started.  Awesome story for this genre, better than most I've read.  Believable plot, and you really get engaged in the characters, found myself talking out loud to them at times!  Great job A. American, can't wait to read the next part.

I hope "A. American" writes a sequel to this book. It is superb and definitely in the top 10% of post-apocalyptic novels. The characters are well-drawn and the action is almost non-stop. The other reviews say it well, so I don't need to repeat them except to reiterate: an excellent novel!

A real page turner, pretty well written and detailed about a trip from Northern Florida to the Orlando area after an EMP.  Some sloppy or nonexistent editing, but doesn't really distract.  Many survival equipment and technique tips. Definitely recommended for those who enjoy this genre.

Excellent read. The writer is obviously what we in the military called a "gear-queer", but this will be very helpful to anyone who lacks training for wilderness survival. What you lack in training you can make up for with gear. The story it'self is very well written with very believable characters (unlike most other fictions). You will find yourself thinking you want to read just one chapter, then wind up going through three or four before you get back to real life. This was the first book I have read by A. American, and I am now a fan. I never give a writer a second chance. If they impress me with the first book that I read by them, I will tell friends they are a great writer. If I'm not impressed, I slam their work with every thing I got, and never buy their stuff again. A. American goes into the great writer list. I love the fact that he will allow you to become comfortable with a character, then kill them off. Life isn't fair, so why should a story be? Why should the "hero" come out on top? A.A. lets you imagine a very realistic world, where he who has the bullets, and the will to use them decide what the rules are. I don't like that because of works like this, more people may start prepping. The fewer survivors after 2016-2020 the better, in my opinion. But as I stated, for those of you who weren't smart enough to do at least one term of service in the Army or Marines, you can get good ideas for gear. He names many items that you can research or purchase, just remember, in a bug-out event, you have to carry all your toys and ammo is a lot heavier than most civilians know. All in all.... read this book if you haven't already, because the world he describes is coming. Not through EMP or CME, but in a much worse form, economic collapse in junction with a tyrannical government falling. Laugh if you want, then you'll just be another zombie starving to death, or worse.

Another "Lights out, no power" type of story that will keep you immersed as you travel with Morgan back to his home 250 miles away.  Starts out with him on the Interstate when his car dies as well as his cell phone.  He soon realizes what has happened as he sees more and more people stranded on the Interstate.  In this story the biggest difference from others I have read is this guy Morgan is prepared and has his pack stocked & with him.  Soon Morgan is hiking home and at first everything is relatively peaceful.  It doesn't take long before people figure out the electricity and most vehicles are never going to work again and all He*l breaks loose.  Morgan is soon thrust into a situation where he has to defend himself with his pistol and runs for his life. Soon Morgan meets a girl at a rest stop, Jess and she joins him on his walk.  They soon meet Thad and the trio is on the road together finding their way to their homes.  It doesn't take long before the trio opts to help what seems to be a husband, wife and two small children but turns out it's a ruse.  Not going to ruin the story for ya so all I will say is it gets exciting really quick!  Morgan is injured along the way and soon the trio are introduced to another character, Sarge.  Sarge is well prepared and as Morgan heals from his wound at Sarge's place other events take place in the country from the federal government.  Not sure yet but it looks like there may be some nefarious motives from the feds.  The story heats up pretty quickly as the trio go on their way to their individual homes with quite a bit of action along the way.  This book series is another great story written very well.  You won't be disappointed if you like action/adventure/end of the world type stories. Now on to the second book in the series!  If you haven't thought of making what I call a "Bug Back Bag" you probably should.  I keep one in my vehicle for making it home for just such an event as is portrayed in this story.

I am now reading the 5th book in this series.  I would give this first book and the other 3 books I have completed 4 stars, but I want to express my disappointment with two of protagonist's (and possibly the author's) inaccurate beliefs.  First, these books take a excessively dim view of contemporary Americans.  It's as if there are very, very few independent, thoughtful, capable, decent people who would respond honorably to such a terrible event.  Good news folks: we're not a nation of helpless, nasty sheep.  Second, and this may be a related point, how is it that no one in these books (indeed in the whole post-apocalypse genre) is religious?!  Last I checked, if you find a group of honorable, brave Americans, including military, quite a few of them are going to be proud believers and given to sharing a prayer of gratitude now and again.  We get it - not everybody is a believer including some people whose behavior is impeccable.  And we understand not wanting to turn a book such as this into one all about God and faith.  But choosing to identify so many (good) characters in an offhand manner as "not religious," yet having no one who is religious, is probably the result of simple common bias.  If and when the SHTF, people of faith will come together to make a powerful positive difference.  Like they have been doing since long before there was a Washington, D.C. or "Preppers."

Also great characterization, you do get to know the characters as the story goes along. As you can probably tell, I am not an expert reviewer, so I only review what I really liked, but I read a ton of this type of genre along with some zombie apocalypse and I tend to review what I feel is a good read. I also like my money and peruse reviews thoroughly, it irritates me when I see reviews like "used plumb pie instead of plum pie", WTF sheeple!!! You're reading for enjoyment and to possibly remove yourself from reality for a moment or hours from your pathetic life, so who gives a @%#$ if a couple of words are not spelled correctly!! Otherwise, I really enjoyed this authors work on this book, have also almost finished #2 and am already looking to see if there's a #3 sequel coming which I am very interested in reading as well. Everybody's opinions are different, but I personally give 5 stars to this book and the sequel! Money well spent and will be looking for more from Mr. A American!!

I am writing this from the perspective of having finished the first two books in the series, but will try to keep the commentary specifically on this first one (Going Home). I have to say that the typical storyline of many of this genre are not as believable as I would like (ie: it is not my vision of how societal breakdown would naturally occur in an EMP-induced SHTF scenario). However, A. American really makes it seem plausible. The "believability" increases in the second book, but the first one is a very good one to start the journey on. Using Forchten's "One Second After" as the gold standard of these types of books, Going Home holds up and compares very closely to this benchmark. The characters are believable and reasonably well-developed. While there are a few grammatical errors, I found them not blatant (as they ARE in many self-produced books of this genre), and I was able to smoothly move through the story without getting hung up on them. To look forward, this book got everything started and provides a very nice entry into the second book (Surviving Home) which is a better and more exciting read...also very plausible and believable.
It kept me interested the whole way through. It seems to tie in with some of today's worries and fears of where our country is headed.

Few survival, apocalyptic novels are more than entertainment. If you want to read a well written story of survival "on the long road home", filled with strong eccentric characters, GOOD guys & BAD guys, and educate yourself as an added bonus, you're in for a fun filled experience. This author tells a survival story much better than most, obviously has military experience but doesn't get so enamoured of  his skill set as to bore non- military such as myself to death. He references survival equipment as he travels on his quest  to reunite with his family far, far away. As a Prepper his planning is spot on, and when I realized that he "really knew his stuff", I settled back to really enjoy the book, so much so, that as soon as I finished, I immediately bought the sequel. A bonus treat is the enclosed Glossary with lots of information on preparedness equipment that the reader can use to develop a thorough Bug Out Bag, in addition to explaining the disaster events affecting the story. A. American knows his stuff, writes well, and you are in for a treat.

If you enjoy an apocalyptic, dystopian type of novel, this book is for you.  I have read a lot of books about "bugging out", but very few about "going home". I traveled a great deal in my previous job and always thought about getting back to my home and family if a disaster were to occur. When I found "Going Home", it's as if A. American wrote the story just for me. The characters are so well written that I felt as if I knew them personally and this is one of those books that once you start reading, you just can't put it down. The plot and story line flow well and it's obvious that A. American is very familiar with prepping and the self-sufficient lifestyle. I really like the fact that the author doesn't just gloss over equipment he carries, but details each item to give the reader a good starting point to investigate whether or not what is being described is something that might benefit them for their own "get home bag".  I just can't say enough about this book. Highly recommended!

Please, A. American, just spend the $500-1000 to get someone to edit the book.  The misspellings, extra words, punctuation, etc., are beyond terrible.  Can't even read the story when one is so distracted by mistakes.  Please, make America proud and let them know we do know how to spell and write.

Excellent depiction of a man's walk home after an EMP strike. Our main character is well prepared for his walk, with his ALICE pack, food, weapons and other equipment because that's the way he is.....a prepared individual. His preperations don't seem forced or contrived whech lends to the credibility of the story. The other characters he encounters have depth and are well written and fit into the story seamlessly. His description  of the rapid deterioration of society also seems plausible, with town's blocking themselves off from the inevitavble waves of refugees and maurauders, and a shadowy governement plot that chills a person to the bone given the current political situation. This book motivated me to put a go-bag in my car, which is a testament to the effectiveness of the author's storytelling ability!

5 Stars for a riveting story, lots of practical information, and a realistic scenario about how quickly desperation changes everything. YES, this book could REALLY benefit from a good edit, but as an editor myself, the minor errors did not detract from an engaging story. As someone who grew up with hurricanes, I believe EVERYONE should make it a priority to store provisions to care for their families during emergencies. It scares me to think the government, under the guise of "martial law," will seize personal property, but I have no doubt it WILL happen. EMP's are a real threat with the instability in the Middle East and other parts of the world. Be prepared to realistically assess your family's situation in anticipation of natural or manmade disasters. Share this book to inspire others!

One second you're driving along the freeway and the next your radio starts and emergency broadcast and then your car stops.  So does everyone else's.  And home is a long long way to go.  This might be kind of a "how to" book for those of us that have the tickle in the back of our mind to be prepared, but don't have the basic survival kit in the trunk.  Read it - well written and enjoyable.

Have you ever wondered what is must be like after an EMP or other apocalyptic event? The author not only describes nearly every action that he takes when one occurs, but lets you know what he did to prepare himself for such an event. It reminded me of Moby Dick, in that it is really three stories in one. A journal of what you should do to prepare yourself, a look into what works and what doesn't when one occurs, and myriad tales of adventure that occur as a result of the event and how they are handled. You actually believe you are part of the protagonist's team of characters.....walking along with them as they experience the aftermath. Three books in the series...I'm on book 2....have book 3 already in my Kindle. Great reading!

This one was a little....different. I kept thinking, during the first 30 or 40 pages, this thing just isn't going anywhere, but it was getting such darned good reviews on Amazon.... So I pressed ahead. It's worth the effort, although the racial and cultural language was.... well, probably unintentionally demeaning. The story really takes off after a bit and becomes a neat roller coaster ride. The first person / third person  transitions weren't bad, and it was good to actually be able to follow what happens to the other characters. Worked for me. It's entertainment. Good setup for a sequel or two. There are some great characters in the book- "Sarge" and Thad being particular favorites. "Going Home" is well worth the money.

I started reading and found them to be a great story, but the filth in the use of the F-word and all the other four letter words were not called for. Some reads might not mind hearing and reading vulgarity and profanity, but I would rather enjoy a truly talented writer who could use better descriptive words, than the GHETTO words found so quickly in these books, will be returning all three for a refund.

I wanted another book to read, after finishing Patriots, and One Second After. This book fit the bill. It pretty much sums up what one would encounter, if something of this magnitude did occur. Anyone living on the Gulf Coast understands what happens when electricity goes out for a few days, up to one week. I cringed thinking of what would happen if this occurred across the country, and for more than just a few days in duration. I really couldn't put this book down, reading it late into the night. I subsequently purchased the other two books and quickly read them as well. I can't wait till the fourth book arrives in June.

I write this after having read all 3 of the books in this series:  "Going", "Surviving" and "Escaping."  The series actually leaves me wondering if there will be further installments: "Defending" and "Restoring".  Perhaps?  Doesn't matter; the first, second and third books stand on their own,  and are great reads.  Put together, they are a well-crafted trilogy: Believable, readable and instructive.  Who could ask for more?  Personally, I would love to collaborate with the author on what SHOULD be two more books; if they are published later, I will definitely read them.  This is the work of a good storyteller!

I started with this book, and was really captured by the stuff that Morgan and friends had to go thru to get home.  After being in a Prep forum for years, seeing the Getting Home Bag used, and what Morgan had in it was really good to see.  The various types of "zombies" and some "sheeple" encountered along the way, and how that worked out was very interesting.  Good to see that there were helping people along the way, and how some energy was used.  I highly recommend it.  (but go ahead and buy book 2, 3, and 4 if you can.  You will not want to wait to see what happens next.)

really well thought out book on how it could happen and what it would be like.  also well done are ideas for getting ready without making lists of stuff that is no fun to read.  perfectly fits with this administration and its unconstitutional overreach of power, and plausibly reflects the likely relationship between citizens and guards in a prison like setting, as well as the utter corruption in attempting to force the American citizens to "turn themselves in" so that the feds can "take care" of them.  good interplay of characters in a believable way, including teens.

It is a riveting tale about events after an economic collapse. An individual (who is prepared ahead of time) tries to get home to his family. It covers his day to day activities and strategies to survive. It also covers what other groups and individuals do (good and bad) to survive.  This gives some excellent advice about things to prepare in advance and some of the warning signs of an impending economic collapse. A very good read. Many of the signs are taken from events that actually happened (signs of collapse) from other countries that experienced the collapse of their economies.

This was one of the best books of this type that I have ever read.  Story of Morgan Carter and his travels across 250 miles of Florida on foot after something like an EMP knocks out most vehicles, all phones and power, and leaves the country in turmoil.  All he wants to do is get home to his family, and he will stop at nothing to accomplish that.  Even if it means taking another's life.  And Morgan has something going in his favor.  He is a survivalist at heart, and has equipped himself to play that role as needed.  Read this one.  You won't be sorry that you did.  Wonderful read.

I received these three books on the 18th.  Today is the 24th and I've read all three.  hey, we've been housebound by an ice storm!  I don't know who this author is, but I hold him in high esteem..  His writing and story telling abilities are on a par with Lamour or McMurtry.  I don't know if I could recommend them to women because I just don't know that many women that would enjoy them. Men with-in the prepper community or prior combat arms will certainly identify with "Sarge" & his boys.  Also, the author lives is country I am very familiar with, where PLA rules...

First off, if you're trying to decide between this book and "One Second After," get "One Second After" first.  It's a little more realistic and dry.  Once you've read that book, you'll be primed for this book.  I'm a slow reader with a full time job yet I still managed to read this book in about 4 or 5 days.  I had a heck of a time trying to put it down.  Sure much of it reads like a commercial with lots of product placements but it doesn't overpower the story.  Take my advice and buy the book, strap in, and prepare for heart pounding action.  Have fun!

I like John Wesley Rawles books. I find them to be informative as well as entertaining. As you read you gleam advice as to what equipment a prepper might utilize or prefer. The adventures in the story are what a person might encounter in a similar circumstance in which the main character found himself. I enjoyed the chapters and was glued to the story. I'm a would-be prepper and enjoyed the story very much. I also enjoyed Patriot just as much. I wish I had highlighted and listed the equipment as I read along. The list would have made a good, first class, shopping list.

~ I have read a lot of Survival books lately,and this was the first that the main character didn't join up with a Gang ,or join up with a local town and leave the one's who really mattered in the background ! This guy stuck to his mission and traveled a couple hundred miles to get to his FAMILY! Every page takes you around the next curve in the trail not knowing what or who you will come up against NEXT! It reminded me of when I used to hike ,with a pack-frame and always wanted to see what was around the next bend Only this one had lots of DANGER!!.

All he has with him is his "Get Home Bag" and a strong desire to see his family again. What he encounters along the way is something every one of us should think about. On the back cover, it says "We live in a wonderfully modern society where anything we want is a mouse click away. But what if it all went away?"
