One of the best post-apocalyptic books I have read in some time. I am on the second book now and enjoying it even more than the first book. Looking forward to reading the entire series.  The characters are down to earth and believable and can imagine them being your neighbors. Very suspenseful scenes throuhout the  book.  As things unfold under our present government you have to believe this is a very believable and possible scenario. I will become a prepper!

I am not a reader. In 36 years I have probably read maybe 20 books. I am glad I got the kindle version because I was reading this at home and at work on break from my phone. No super hero BS in this book. Just a guy trying to get home and maintain his humanity while keeping his goal in mind. Awesome group of characters and nice to see some gear mentioned too. Can't wait until the third book. I have already read the second book also " Surviving Home".

I read the whole series and all I can say is, "Loved, loved, loved the books!" I have done nothing for the last four days except read the books! I won't ruin it for anyone who is considering buying these books by telling them about the storyline other than to say, "If you love reading what it would be like if the grid went down, then these are the books for you." I hope this author comes out with a fifth, sixth, or even more books.

I'm a big fan of this genre, and A. American doesn't disappoint in this first-in-the series book.  Compelling characters are fleshed out as the storyline is expertly constructed.  It's hard to put this one down as you are rooting for Morgan and Thad to make it home alive.  Since I started on this series late, I was excited to see that the second book in the series had already been published and got it to my Kindle before finishing this one.

I for one loved this book and all of the sequels.  ( to the point where this series is my favorite to pick up and re read before bed each night).  As much as some of the earlier reviews didn't appreciate all the brand name dropping and super specific descriptions of what it takes to accomplish simple things that we take for granted.  I felt there is almost a Stephen king feel to that style.  I can't wait for the next book to come out!

I was looking for something to read, as i read myself to sleep every night. A. American is an original name and it caught my attention immediately. I have been waiting for the shoe to fall for several years now and thought why not. I downloaded it, climbed in to bed and began to read. However I did not plan on being hooked, and was still turning pages the following morning. A very entertaining read, but not recommended for sleep.

In this book you learn about how regular people can be friend or foe. In a short period of time you will watch some people take advantage of the situation and some go out their way to help.  I like this book because it goes into detail of the survival items you can purchase in real life. I found some of the ascents a little hard to follow, but got passed it shortly. Lots of action and surprises. Can't wait to read the next book.

Well written and entertaining. The author really does his research regarding equipment and gear. I actually researched and purchased some camping/survival gear based on the items carried by the main character. The characters are very well developed and engaging. The book is written in a manner that keeps you wanting more. I immediately purchased the second book in the series and flew through that as well. Cannot wait for book 3.
Great Read!
Good read!!
Great Book.
Great book.
Great read.
Exceptional

I had the audio book, and the narrator was great. This book is very good, and easy to follow. IT is a little heavy on talking about the gear and brand names, and the first person jumping between characters in the second book gets annoying. Also, the F word is used very liberally, making it hard to listen to around family, and keeps me from giving the book to my elderly mom, but I found the book pretty entertaining.

I found the story line compelling and informative. Being a Florida native, I have gone through the regions described in the book many times. I like the authors writing style. There were several errors, one in particular was the flow of the Suwannee River, and the author should have more than one proof reader for future books. Overall, I look forward the purchasing "Surviving Home" when it is available in paperback.

Self published SHTF novels, I have found, generally fall into two categories, good or abysmal. I am pleased to say that this is excellent. Despite a few minor editing quibbles, the story flows well and the characters are believable. My military background, plus growing up in Rural New Zealand is something of an advantage in de3aling with the story of the journey Morgan undertakes. I highly recommend this book

This book is not far from possible!  The characters are well developed and are easy to follow.  The research is there even though I Morgan's pick contained some items that most people would not carry on a regular basis.  Don't get me wrong...I would love to have a set of NVG at my disposable and a micro solar charger.  No matter how you look at the book was great and I look forward to the next installment.

Read this and the next (Surviving Home) - incredible books and really interesting characters and story. Difficult to put down. An eye opening and realistic view of what could occur in a world that has changed little in thousands of years except for our reliance on technology. There is a fins line that keeps us from turning into savages... this book removes that line and shows the best & worst of humanity.

Going Home is filled with expert discussion of gear but much moe.  An engaging, well plotted novel with characters who are alive with inner thought, human foibles and reactions to the challenges likely to occur in an apocalyptic world that are provacative of a "what would you do?" Reader consideration.  This may be the long awaited beginning a a new "Out of the Ashes" saga.  I hope so!

Get ready America, this could happen to US. Wow, what a story of one man on the road after a EMP attack in America.  This story tells of a man and his journey home.  It is a great tale of what you could face on the roads after an EMP event and how difficult it would be to get home.  This story should scare you and make you start to prepare for whatever may come your way. Great Book! Read it!

I am not sure why I started to read this genre of books but I cannot get enough. I thought this book was a great read. The people he meets, situations he encounters and decisions he makes on his journey to get home are realistic. One would think that genre would get duplicated but A. American does a great job of changing things up. I could not wait for the next book and continuing the saga.

I read a lot of these books I gather important information from them all to improve our families emergency preparedness kits, plans and backup plans.  A very good read and these acts of looting, violence, etc are very real when people are taken out of their normal element. Safety and security should definitely be taken serious consideration when planning cat 4 or 5 catastrophe planning.
Great book
Good read.
its decent

Loved the prepper/survivalist nature of this book.  It was a fun journey to go one with lead character Morgan Carter as all electricity goes out from an EMP.  A American delivers a solid, honest and entertaining story.  For fans of The End and Long Road Home by Geoffrey Hopf and also fans of James Wesley Rawles this is perfect.  Just got book #2 from A American Surviving Home.

This book drew me in to the point that I couldn't put it down. One of my most favorite books of all time. Since reading the first book I have purchased all of the subsequent books that are available and I am almost finished with the 3rd edition. I highly recommend this book especially if you are into survivalist type books. I can't speak highly enough about the series!

A faced paced read, this novel flows well and has been well edited for better enjoyment of readers. The plot is not original within the genre however the grit and depth to the characters makes for an altogether different and more personal experience. The gear details often are a bit expansive, but do not detract from the flow of the book. Great story for the price.

This is a fantastic book.  Its a page turner to say the least and I have read his follow-up book Surviving Home also. All of the characters that he has created are interesting.  I really haven't read a book in which I have cared about all of the characters.  He is a great writer and I will follow this series.  Thank you Angery American - love your books!

I've never been that into reading. Mainly because of time and not finding books that hold my interest.  I had this book recommended to me by a friend so I gave it a shot. From the first chapter I was hooked. I've never found a book I would call a page turner until now. I currently just finished the second book and am anxiously waiting to read the third.

Great story of people reacting to a world without the everyday things we take for granted. The author does an excellent job of developing the characters and even when the story splits off to continue following them it is done smoothly with enough reference to the other characters to ensure continuity. I will definitely keep this on my 're-read list!

Was a very interesting book, kept you on the edge of your seat. But so unrealistic 1. The Government would never do to the US citizens what it recommends in this book. 2. If it came down to the fact where there was some sort of E.M.P DHS should have the ability to have ppl in work camps no matter what ppl still need to earn there keep not just get free hand outs when the Gov is working so hard to help us

The book is well organized with a plot line that has some twists and turns.  However, there are racist overtones, and the main character's supplies read as an endless list of product placements. Overall it's a good read for the price.

Interesting read.  I found the book to be a bit repetitive and the author makes the assumption that the reader is well versed on the various survival items in his and other folks' backpacks during the "ordeal."

I loved this book. It's a how too set up a bug out/get home bag. I will definitely be reading the next book. What made it extra fun is I know the area after walking the Florida trial through Ocala National forest this year and meeting the Sun People and they definitely do smell...A LOT lol
Variation on a theme, Similar to others in the genre. Felt slow in a few spots but not dragging. Characters were interesting with plenty of action. It's worth getting and reading.
If you are a fan of the PostApoc genre as I am you'll probably enjoy the book; conversely, give it a pass.
While I enjoyed the story, I was turned off by the language.  The author has set things up for a sequel, but I'll have to decide whether it will be worth my time.
All i can say is that I found this to be a very enjoyable read. There was not a dull moment in the book. I recommend it for any interested in this genre.

Loved the story and a great start for a new author, however, the new author needs to learn a few things about editing.  The errors are glaring, but if you can get past them it is a good read.  Another new author off to a great start and without the editing errors is Tyler Roberts.  Check out his book Truth's Blood.  Great story line and a well executed SHTF read.
Good read
Fun book!
Makes you realize what can happen in a very down to earth way and gives you a wholly different perspective on how to cope in extremely difficult circumstances.

Good book, at first the author starts a bit too technical, writing almost more about the gear then telling the story, but after the first few pages the plot thickens and the story really starts getting interesting. Sarge and boys are a great addition and provide a great break with humor. Very good if you like this kind of stuff. I do ;)

This really kept me on the edge of the pages. I wanted to turn the pages quicker than I could read them. I bought all in this series and now I'm ready for more. I always wondered what I would do in a situation like this. Not sure I could do the things the main character does but I'm thinking if push came to shove --- Yes I could/would.

I easily started to like the protagonist. He seemed like a cool dude I would be honored to call a friend. The book definitely made me laugh a couple times and the hard decisions some characters made were completely understandable. All in all, this author made my radar list. I plan to seek him out in pretty much any future publication.

A good story and well told. There are alot of grammer erros in this book, but keep in mind that it is the authors first. So if a person can get past looking down their nose at that, they will find that it is a well told story. I enjoyed the book, and actually had a hard time putting it down. I look forward to the next in this series.

Yes, this book had many grammatical errors, at least the original kindle version that I purchased, but I really enjoyed the story. It drew me in, and I couldn't put it down. I've also read the second book (Surviving Home), and enjoyed that as well. I look forward to the 3rd book in the series (Escaping Home), due out end of October.

I really enjoyed this book, when I first got it, it was so great that I continued reading it all night into the next day only stopping to eat or pit stops.  Being familiar with the area he was in I was almost right there going though each area in his journey. This is the second book by A. American I have read, keep them coming. TY

My wife got me started on this series and have read the first three (the fourth is currently in the works).  If you are interested in a "prepper type" scenario, you will enjoy this book.  It keeps several stories going, provides a lot of information on equipment and makes you think...it is just a pretty good read.

I believe something like this could happen. The characters, the detail, the fear, the reactions of whole neighborhoods, the author made the reader part of everyday living,death and surviving. How fast the country changed. There are so many "people" who don't know the first thing about taking care of themselves.

I read this book first online, and then bought it as soon as it was available.  This book is a rocking good read, start to finish.  After reading this book I was urged to start writing again and I finally started again.  I would recommend this book to anyone who is interested in SHTF or end of the world type stories.

Great read...I am on the second book now and like the first one, I am finding it hard to put it down. Great characters and scenario. I have read a ton of these kind of books and this one falls into my top five survival stories. Worth reading for sure. He knows his gear and assumes you do as well.... which I like.

I read this entire series in a week or so, theres enough action to keep a person interested though I dont know how realistic some of the characters are. Seems the preppers have all hi tech name brand items and have absolutely everything they could ever need. Iam waiting for the next book in this this series.

I'm not an English teacher so I'm not going to waste anyone's time criticizing the present perfect tense of blah blah blah barf.  I've read a ton of this genre and this book was a super fun read.  I just received the second book and have pre-ordered the third.  Looking forward to see how the story continues.

I give it 5 stars because versus most of its peers in the post apocolypse space - this one and its sequel stand out. Characters have depth. Story has all the ingredients that grab me and hold me to a book. I especially liked the unlikely friendships that become such a central and important part of the story.

I hate adventure novels that spend a lot of time explaining what things are and how they work. The other thing I don't care for is the main character not getting a scratch on them. This is not one o  those books. But, it still gives you an idea of what life might be if TSHTF. Can't wait to read the next one.

Excellent post event fiction. AA puts you in the shoes of a regular prepper, caught in a worst case scenario. Realistic characters and horrific events combine to keep you glued to this book. I finished it in two days. If you are an individual interested in survival or post-apoc fiction then buy this book!
Love it.

I love this genre and this is one of the more exciting ones out there.  Was reading 299 days but this book has more action in first four chapters than that series does in the first four books.  Hard to put down and more feasible than a lot of what's out there.  Price is right too!  Highly reccomend.

I was hooked on this book right from the start.  The author's writing was relaxed and witty.  I couldn't put the book down.  I have read quite a few books about this subject and found this book to be very realistic and plausible.  Just ordered the second in the series and can't wait to start it.

This first book in the Home series just captures you from the beginning and pulls you in. The action and suspense are never ending. The characters are easy to relate to, reminding you of someone you may already know. This book is an eye opener. I highly recommend it to any and all. A must read!

I appreciated the premise and found the book to be extremely useful in my own preparations. Also enjoyed the geographical detail. I constantly flipped back and forth between the book and google maps and was able to trace the journey with incredible accuracy.  Looking forward to the next book!

This book will make you think of the possibilities that lay before the working man and his family / friends. Not being prepared with a food supply and access to clean water and having to deal with the "give me" mind set of the 47% mixed into our working class now. Who can you trust?

Fiction!? Perhaps. Realistic? Absolutely! Not only possible scenarios but probable as well considering who is supposed to be running the government and their stated goals of " fundamentally transforming America." An excellent read. It tracks well and challenges my Kindle to keep up!

Just loved this!  The storyline kept me intrigued throughout, and left me wanting more.  It was obvious that the writer knew his material, and gave many bits of practical advice for anyone wanting to learn about survival in an emergency situation.  Would like to see more from this writer!

I enjoy this genre and in particular, this book.  Although I have read a few of the better know novels in this category, this was my first that focused on getting home under difficult circumstances.  I quickly searched for and read the next book in the series and look forward to the 3rd.

What can I say its a great story and an easy read. I found myself hooked into the characters. This story was originally posted in a forum. I read the whole thing for free and grabbed a copy in appreciation of the effort the author put into the story. Get a copy now you wont be sorry.

Best book I have read to date on the subject.  It is easy to tell the author knows and lives what he writes.  Excellent level of technical expertise.  Great character development, the reader can really pick up on the personalities of the characters.  Highly recommended.  Five Stars!!

I am not a avid reader but I am hooked on this series! Can't wait for the next one to come out. I would recommend you start from the beginning if you want to read them. They give many ideas on what you should stock up on and what is likely to happen if it ever happens!! I love it!!

Don't leave home without an everyday carry/get home bag.  We will be adding more stored water to our vehicles, supplies to our tool boxes, and gear to the storage cubbies inside our truck.  This book really enlightened us as to how difficult even a 60 mile journey could be.

If you have every thought about being stranded a long way from home and wandered how you get home. this is a great story about a stranded man very focused on making it home to his family. Very good book and easy to think about all the situation could unfold. Very good book.

If you even remotely interested in Doomsday survival type scenario novels then this is a must read. It was well written and the pace was perfect. It was a page turner for me and kept me up late a few nights as I couldn't put it down. That alone is my sign of a good book.

I really liked this book.  It has a good story, some details for bugging out and it kept my interest the entire time.  There is a fair amount of swearing, but it did not keep from reading it.  Many of this genre tend to do that.  I would definately recommend to a friend.

I don't write reviews on things I buy from amazon. But I just had to on this book, I use to live in the area he's walking thur, he did his research on the aera, good story line. Great writing ! Frist book I've read in a long time that I realy did not want to put down !

A very well written and thought out book.  As realistic as anyone can be without actually going through the trials and tribulations of a total grid blackout.  Exactly what I could see happening if we had and EMP or MCE happen here in the states.  Well worth the read.
thanks!
WOW!!!!
love it

Looking forward to any other works by A American. In a discussion about prepping, I realized that time is getting short. I may never be 100 per cent physically ready but works like this help my mental preparation a great deal. Thanks for the hard work and the help.

I liked this book. Some books in this genre struggle to build characters and a plot line that keeps me interested from start to finish. I'm from Central Florida, so it was neat to read this book and know most of the place where Angry was taking himself to get home.

I loved this book as well as Surviving Home.  I did not want to put the book down and couldn't wait till I was able to get back to it.  I had it read in 3 days (had to sleep and work) or it would have been a one day adventure.  Cannot wait for the next book!!!!!!

I bought the Kindle version of "Going Home". I highly recommend this book as entertaining reading. I couldn't put it down. I am definitly buying the next book, hoping it picks up where this one left off. I enjoyed the charectors and the story had a nice build up.

I find it hard to find books I'm interested in often times, especially fiction. This book, however, was outstanding. It is very entertaining and fairly realistic as far as the equipment used, etc. I am going to read the second book in the series right away.

A great book the first of a series. How a group of people join together to  make it in a country that has been hit with an EMP and now maybe the goverment is the real enemy.No zombies or monsters because the people are bad enough. A really great series.

This story by A. American is easy to believe, and he did an excellent job of portraying facts of tomorrow with facts of today. The story line is something that has gone through all of our minds at one time or another. Going home is another must read.

Got the book at a book panel and signing. Started without any preconceptions and after listening to the author describe his series decided it was a series I would like. I started the book and by midnight I was halfway done. Very enjoyable read.

This has got to be the best book I've read !!!!!!!  The characters are real people. Some people are so blind to the facts of life WITHOUT the government and survival of the fittest.  The love of family is so real.  I can't wait for book three!

This is a wonderful story line and I loved the characters. You really are a talented writer and kept my interest from beginning to end. I hope to see more of these characters in the future and I'm looking forward to reading more books by you!

Excellent plot. Nice attention to details. The reader really gets involved in the characters and their lives. Could use better proof reading. I found the errors a bit distracting. People who like post apocalyptic stories will enjoy this one.

Excellent story which contains a lot of excellent prepper information. Has references to many items that one should consider for a Bug out Bag and beyond.  Realistic scenarios and timelines for how things could degenerate. Recommend highly.

That was a killer story that was easily believable. Not just an action packed story line, but an excellent emergency equipment reference guide. I've researched and even purchased several pieces of equipment Morgan utilizes during his trek.

This is a wonderful book which brings to life the possibilities of a country without electricity, water, and within hours the masses become savages.  Good tips for everyday preparedness.  A glimpse into a possible governmental breakdown.

Loved this book, read the second book as well.  Now I can't wait to see what happens next!  NEED BOOK THREE!~  Jonesing for a fix, it was a real page turner, the first in a long time where I just couldn't consume it fast enough!  GREAT!
The perfect prepper book. Loved every page and hated it when it was over..why did it have to end, lol.

Great series the characters are well defined and the plot is right on. There is also some really good aspects in this book that you might not have thought of in this type scenario. Love the books can't wait for the new one. Good job!

So far the story is entertaining and the book was well paced. Sure there are things that could be picked on or picked apart I am sure some readers will try to do just that. I am looking forward to seeing where things go for book 2.

This book was amazing! I just can't say enough about it. It kept my attention the whole way through and I couldn't wait to get back to it if I had to stop reading. I really hope he writes something else, I'll be the first in line!

I love these stories and this was great.  I live in FL so I could visualize the scenes as it played out.  Great author who keeps the action moving.  Love it! Can't wait for book 4 to come out and continue the adventure! John K

This is an interesting series of books, and I hope to read the third book.  This is an actual series of events that could happen, hopefully not, but it does display what could happen to humanity when the safety net disappears.

A Great read - great action - very good storyline - and the character development was excellent.  I'm already looking forward to the next book.  This book solves issues that you will have to deal with if something bad happens.
Action

One of the things I liked most was the examination of the physiological elements that will drive ordinary people 'over the edge'. Be prepared to take notes on what you need to start with , or change, about your preparedness.

After reading Lights Out I was not expecting another great book of this type. I was mistaken, the book  was great. Character development was right on. The plot was great and now finished I have ordered the second book.

I don't read a lot of books. I stumbled across this  book at a book store and read the first chapter. I was hooked and went home and ordered all 3 in the series. It's entertaining and informative and has a good story.

A terrific first effort. Fast paced and engaging.  Sign me up for the next in the series. While you are at it, sign me up to proof read the next one as well. I'd do it for free just to be one of the first to read it.

I hope the sequel(s) keep the organic feel of this one. Such a good story and the characters reel you in and don't let go. Pretty clever to expand the cast towards the end, also. Will be recommending and sharing!

So, have you just ever looked around and wondered what would have if the power went off, and never came back on? This book does just that, and shows how society falls apart when the comforts we enjoy disappear!

I really enjoyed the book.  It viewed the stranded traveler from a slightly different perspective than I have read in the past.  Kind of made me think of Jack Spirko as the character who was trying to get home.

A lot of previous reviews focus and complain about the grammer.  Just read the story, it's entertainment.  SMH  Well done book, the 2nd one was just as good and Im anxiously waiting for the next in the series.

I'm not a prepper, but this book makes me think about it.  It's story may very well be prophetic for the times in which we live.  I'm sold on the series and can't wait to move on to book 2, in my case audio.

There are so many books of  survival but this  book helped me to determine what is necessary for my bug out bag. Not sure I could carry everything Morgan carried  he had everything but the kitchen sink. LOL

Great books! These books cost me a lot of sleep and was so interesting. When reading these you can see how some of the stories could happen in real life. I can't wait until these have an audio version.

I have read many books but few of them I read with a highlighter.  James Wesley, Rawles first book Patriots was one.  This is definitely another.  Great story and looking forward to the follow up book

This is a must read. Although fictional, it is well written and takes you on the journey. This book is one that I could not get enough of. Now, I am in seach of another one that will hold my interest.

A fantastic story of adventure after an EMP attack by our own goverment, to reset the economy and gain control of the population of the United States without having to be controlled by the Constution.
Can't wait to read the second book. The writer did a great job of character development . Looking forward to see where the story goes. I'm hoping Morg and his family get to hook up with Thad and his.
Very plausible plot line. Believable characters in realistic situations. Can't wait to read the next one and learn how one survives everyday life and what comes next after the canned food runs out.
Great book. Loved to be prepared like that too. Enjoyed it very much. I feel it was written well. Easy to follow all the characters ,and relate to them all.  I would recommend the second book too.
Great fast paced read that grabs you and keeps you. Kind of a no brainer in the thought department but well worth the time. It may even help educate some out there whe are common sense challenged.
One can imagine what it would be like to live during a situation like this. Its spooky stuff because one can imagine what it would be like by reading it. I look forward to reading the sequels.
This is a fantastic book based on PSHTF scenario that seems to take into account many things that way it might be. Gives you some great ideas to think about, worthy of being in your library.
Really enjoyed the book for the quality of the author he's no Preston or Childs but the story is good the charaters are developed enough to fully enjoy and the story line is the near future.
This book is chillingly close to what may lie ahead in the very near future in our own country. Everyone should read and take a realistic look at their own preparedness for any major crisis
i was instantly hooked! i couldnt put this down and had to instantly start the second book. The suspense is awesome, if this was made into a tv series it would blow away the walking dead!!
Just started reading it while waiting on another book to come available.  Could not put it down.  A must read, and then you've got to read the second in what I hope becomes a large series.
This is truly an amazing book that shows the a realistic struggle somebody would go through in the grid down situation. I've already read it three times and I've only had the book a month
You can see yourself facing the same situations as the characters in the book. Well written, well researched, great story line. I am gifting this series to all my good friends and family!
Very interesting and believable story.  Really made me think about just how fast things can go bad and how dependent we all are on electricity.  Great read.  I highly recommend this book.
Great
Great
I liked this story, good characters and great plot. I only hope there is a sequel as it seems there is a lot more story to tell. There was also a lot of info about survival and prepping.
This book describes a man trying to get home after shtf while he is a couple of hundred miles from home.  All the stuff in there is very plausible.  Very well written and kept you going.
This book is a good eye opener for those who don't consider what this country could turn into during a disaster.  Take away everything we take for granted and........well, read the book.
Great book.  Author really knows his survival toys.  Great characters.  Great plot line.  I'm now reading the second book in the series.  So far, its at least as good as the first one.
Fantastic tips and the writer captures the essence of human nature when the SHTF.  A great book for those who are serious "preppers" and those that are just thinking about it.
This is a fun book to read. There are quite a few grammatical errors and more product plugs than I wish to see/read, but overall a great book. Looking forward to finishing the series.
Author has a good imagination and his story is grounded in reality. It is a good story about determination and survival, with some colorful characters. I hope it never gets this bad!
A very good book, with an excellent cast of characters. I read this book as it was being written, but I still had to purchase a hard copy. Buy it, you will enjoy it. Very realistic.
Really makes you think of how unprepared we are for a situation like that to happen and makes you rethink what is important in life if and when a situation like this would happen.
The story depicts the nature of people and how they responds in emergencies through trust, commonsense, greed, power ans corruption from who we would like to think we could trust.
First book I've read by this author but definitely won't be my last!  Really enjoyed the story line.  Have also read the second book in the series & am anxiously awaiting a third!
I give this book 5 stars. It was a page turner. It really gets you thinking. And now I am rethinking my prepping supplies. You may think this is fiction, bit it can really happen.
Awful. Unrealistic.
A must read for anyone who likes SHTF books. Lots of great ideas mixed into a good storyline. Finished this book and the next two in the series in a week. Couldn't put them down.

I loved this book from start to finish. You go along on the journey with the main character. He is easy to relate to and quickly pulls you in and gives you a lot to think about. You needn't be a prepper to enjoy this book. Although you may be one by the time you finish it! It's a good solid story with a believable cast of characters. When I finished it I was quick to pick up the next book in the series to continue where the first left off. It's obvious by the authors attention to detail that he is invested in the survivalist lifestyle. I have enjoyed many books that comprise the post-apocalyptic genre, my favorite being Margret Atwood's The Handmaidens Tale. Just read Alas Babylon, a classic. Going Home is from the survivalist niche of the genre, which tends to express a worldview laced with fear and paranoia, with a strong antigovernment prejudice. If that's what you are looking for and literature is not really your thing, go for this book. I give this a 1 just because AA can tell a story, but he sure can't write it. Acronyms so dominate the narrative that it makes for a very choppy read (there is a glossary). But there is no excuse for all the errors! Others have pointed out the grammatical and spelling errors, the ridiculous inconsistency in tense and point of view. I mean, do us all a favor; if you are going to publish something, proofread it or have someone do it for you. There are also a lot of tired stereotypes crowding the action and character makeup. Sure, elements of the storyline are entirely feasible, but that's just not enough. But if you like to curl up for a survivalist read in your underground bunker with a collection of assault weapons and food stores, this may ring your bell.
